title: Fabulously cheesy but worth the visit for a fun night out
review: India meets Bollywood meets Disney and all in a sort of good way. Audio allows many nationalities to enjoy it all in their own home language. Great costumes, good energy and dancing, bit of overacting and delayed scene changes but all adds to the humour and joy of the night. I think it was supposed to be more serious than I took it to be, our friends took it more seriously and loved it as well, go you wont be disappointed whatever your expectation. PS well priced drinks get served to you in your chairs so a nice touch if you hadn't made it to the bar prior.

title: Show for tourists
review: A show with many videos and dances.

title: Wonderful performance of the Taj Mahal story
review: Really worth catching if you staying in Agra.  The play Taj Mahal a love story was magnificent.  Mughal handicrafts can be seen there. I liked the cleanliness and arrangements there and nothing to dislike.

title: Beautiful drama
review: Beautiful drama. If you have nothing to do, this is a good place to pass time.

title: nice costumes and nice final scene , the rest so and so
review: a bit long and some times boring. great venue, beautiful costumes and choreography , very touristy though

title: Average show, Poor service
review: We are giving it a two star due to scarcity of activities in agra at night. Otherwise, at most one-star! Well over 80% of audience are from group tours. If it's your first time in India, this show is an acceptable entertainment for an othwise quite evening.

title: Quite enjoyable.Worth the price?
review: Nice that you could have a small bite and a drink while seated and that the text was translated into several languages to be followed through the headphones. The show was lively and colourful.

title: An evening show in Agra
review: This is the only evening show in Agra to my knowledge. It is song, and dance, and a very special show.

title: Animal abuser
review: Attended the show this evening, which was colorful and entertaining.

title: A MUST SEE SHOW
review: You must see this show if you visit Agra. It is the story of how and why Taj was built. Costumes are good and it inspires you with a taste of India. Maybe not from the best shows of planet earth,... but if this is your point definitely watch another show.

title: Fabulous show of history
review: We were staying at the raddisson blu hotel and this place wasn’t far from it ( 3 mins). We arrived here with our guide and were shown very efficiently to our seats. We were asked what language we wanted to hear the show in and we’re given a pair of headphones for the show. For us it was English and it came through the headphones very clear and in sync with the actors. Indian dancing was excellent as well as the props and acting. Not on for too long but at least it was something to do in the evening!

title: Indian fairy tale
review: Performance is very nice, you can see all stage from every seat, you can take audio with your native language. Costume are very beautiful and bright, but actor's game is naive, as in old indian movies. Anyway good impressions and memories

title: awesome place
review: It is located at the VIP Road of Agra. It is one of the ideal places to spend evening at Agra since one can enjoy some of the cultural happenings in the city. They organize shows which include concerts, traditional dance, drama, plays and exhibitions on a regular basis. The important attraction at this center is the play by Sanskritik Natyashala 'Mohabbat-the-Taj' a series of play depicting the saga of love.

title: Wonderful show
review: I absolutely loved this show, was about the love story between the Emperor and his love.

title: Good
review: I had my tour on the Christmas evening. I take my own transport to the premises. The local is very beautiful and the installations are very good. The show is excellent. Good music, good actors, excellent history. Highly recommended.

title: Wow! Bollywood meets Broadway!
review: Forget the productions in New York and London (I have been there too). This is spectacular. A sumptuous theatre, large stage, audio phones for most languages, food and drink on order and served to your comfortable seat. A large-scaled live production telling the love story between Shah Jahan and Mumtaz Mahal. Good acting and drama interspersed with energetic danging (large cast) and music. The ending is spectacular and surprising (you will have to see it!)

title: Most reputed place in northern India
review: I went there with my guests believe me it's a place to visit after Taj Mahal because it gives you a chance to connect that era of 17th century. The making of Taj Mahal with a documentary on mines of marble was awesome. The collection of marble products here is incomparable & you will get whatever you require.

title: beautifull place
review: if you have reach agra before you seen Taj mahal so must go and enjoy the theater show so you understand more about taj mahal its littel bit expensive but very good show

title: wah taj
review: The best live show depicting the history of tajmahal and its glory. Well performed by the artists playing various roles of that era. Indeed a must see feature once you are at agra that too in the evenings where in you can utilize your time as the monuments entry is already close by the entrance time to this live performance.

title: An Insight to Taj Mahal
review: We were in Kalakriti Cultural Centre during our trip to Agra. It is a well managed theatre like Broadway or those in West End.

title: Family Tour
review: It is a good place, there are lot of drama & culture shows which gives you the background of mugal culture.

title: Absolutely Delightful Show
review: You can't leave Agra without visiting Kalakriti for the Taj Mahal Show.... it's an absolute must to complete your Taj Mahal and Agra experience. Loaded with truly beautiful costuming, music and a beautiful story-line, this Bollywood type production would take you on a beautiful cultural journey.

title: Taj Mahal show
review: This was a very touristy show with good dancing and music and lovely costumes. However it was overpriced and I would not recommend. Cost was £20 per head.

title: With Family
review: This is a wonderful and worth to see as thehistory of Taj Mahal with folk dnaces are very good.This show is costly but everyone must see

title: Spectacular show! A must-see!
review: Mohabbat the Taj is a saga of love. You get headphones, so you can follow in the language of your choice. It immortalizes the Taj Mahal love story. It’s loaded with gorgeous costumes, spectacular dancing, state of the art light and sound. They’ve created the world’s largest replica of the Taj Mahal in marble. Brilliant! It’s a fitting wrap-up of your Taj Mahal experience. Don’t miss it!

title: The usual song and dance for tourists - but with a twist
review: Compared to other shows that try to convey local culture and history to tourists, this one shows investment in stage paraphernalia, costumes, coordinated singing and dancing and theatricals. It also has the tragic and romantic story of the Mughal emperor who built the Taj Mahal as a mausoleum to his favorite wife Mumtaz who died at childbirth. Stuff for operas. The 1-hour show is carried out well Bollywood style. Simultaneous translation through huge earphones is weird because you hear the actors speaking in Hindu as well, and after a while only gibberish. Be forewarned that the toilets everyone rushes to after the show are atrocious.

title: Poor to average, I couldn't decide until I read some other reviews
review: We paid 50 USD, how much the tickets really are seems to vary and of course they would pay commission to whoever sold you the ticket.

title: Skip this
review: Having paid 35 euro you have rather high expectations... Just to find yourself landing in the déja vu of old tourist trips to Spain. The performance was just not worth it. Not enough Bollywood style mass scenes. Also following the English translation eroded the experience. The text sounded ridiculous.

title: must watch
review: this is a really must watch convention centre, they have huge collection of marble inlay, wood handicraft and much more. The show is excellent.

title: Demonstration of Craftsmanship
review: Here you can witness the marble inlay process so that you can more fully appreciate all that goes into each piece.  This is also the place to purchase your marble inlay pieces.  The bigger pieces they will ship directly to your home.

title: Marble Inlay and Indian Carpets
review: Our guide took us to Kalakriti to see how marble inlay and rug weaving is done.  It was interesting to see the traditional way of creating inlay and learn about the durability of the marble.  The prices of a very small item are astronomical!  We also saw a man weaving a rug in the design of his family that he learned at a very early age.  We bought a rug here and I'm sure my guide was pleased as he most likely received a commission from the sale.  The rug arrived at home and I just love the colors and design!

title: We saw Mohabbat the Taj
review: ... which is the story of the Taj Mahal - you can listen in English through a headset. Lika a Bollywood movie coming to life - a wonderful experience! Well worth seeing but, sad to say, no photography allowed!!!

title: Nice place to see history revision for foreigners
review: This place is special for foreigners / Indians were You can actually see huge replica of Taj Mahal and you can buy lots of handcrafts, evening you can enjoy love story of Sah Jahan as stage performances.

title: nothing special
review: The idea of the show was much better than the actual show. It was a bit glitzy and without substance. The outfits were colourful and the dancing was so-so.

title: Overpriced, very average, would advice to avoid.
review: The dancers were good but the singing is a recording. It was very corny with the English audio headphones translating throughout. Very expensive! Would not go again or recommend unless you like Disney-esque cheesy musicals and wearing headphones. Shame there is not much else to do in Agra, other the the obvious!

title: So corny and wooden, give it a miss
review: I'm no snob but I do like a decent show or play. This is so below average and an embarrassment for Agra to offer up as real theatre. The actors are forced into wooden display that they are like puppets on a badly pulled string. I accept that the dubbing is required because tourists sit with head phones and even that is farcical. For the high price, save your money and put it towards broadway, the west end or the comparison for where you come from. More tosh than Taj I'm afraid.

title: Inlay Craft Demo
review: The tour that I was on had the Kalakriti workshop as a stop. This was after visiting the Taj Mahal, with the impression of the beautiful pieta dura inlay fresh in our minds. We watched craftsmen grind precious / semi-precious stones into very fine artworks, on display in the showroom. The ratio of visitors to salesmen is seemingly 1 to 1. Most things are very expensive. A small pierced marble  box with an inlay top was $165. / virtually the same thing was being sold at a truck stop for $40.00, the differences were imperceptible. This place is like an emporium, there was also jewelry, sandalwood ($$$) carvings and saris. I bought 2 saris for about $200. each, and was sorry to have paid as much when I bought 2 better ones in Varanasi for $35.00 each. Patience and self-contol of impulse buys are invaluable. I'd love to know what sort of kick back our tour guide gets from this place.

title: One of the best live shows I have ever seen
review: This 90-min. show depicts historical story how Taj was conceived and built. Well trained actors/actresses/dancers and nicely directed acts and well choreographed dances make you glued to the show till last. You will also see the replica of Tajmahal at the end. One of the most exiting part was execution of scene changing in the dark without making any sound. Although this show is basically in Hindi and Urdu, but you can enjoy it in different languages (German, French and English) through headphones.

title: Hidden Gem for Sure
review: Found this show at the Kalakriti Cultural and Convention Center while surfing the internet about things to do in Agra. The Mohabbat The Taj Show was excellent!. Very entertaining, good acting,  beautiful songs,dazzling costumes and awesome semi- classical type dancing. Headphones are needed and provided free of cost if you don't speak Hindi. Tickets can be bought at the Venue (not far from the Crystal Sarovar Premier Hotel). Refreshments can be bought inside the theater before the show begins. My teenage daughter loved it. Worth it!

title: Sellling marble and other nice quality giftware
review: We went to see the marble demonstration, which was nice.Looked at other things of interest. Interesting story of this family that started selling marble after Taj was built. As for buying anything, prices were  higher than I prefer                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      jI was a nice  stop though to see

title: Good tacky glitzy fun
review: 90 minute Bollywood type show telling romantic story of Taj Mahal

title: highly recommended to go
review: we reached with a little delay but since we were a big group they had waited for us . the show was about Momtaz Bano & Shah Jahan . really i found it great , in addition to the history of Taj Mahal ,...you see Indian traditional dance , dress ,...at finally you can get photo with performers. there are also some visible items in waiting saloon . it was one of my best memories at India and i recommend everybody not to miss it .

title: Fun
review: Our family had a fun evening out at the Kalakriti Culture Show.  It’s basically a musical about the love story of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz-Mahal.  It’s a live show involving very energetic dancing and singing and spectacular costuming with a taste of Bollywood. Also, there is some video involved as well.

title: A slice of hisltory
review: This production will mesmerise you. It tells you the story of Taj Mahal in true bollywood style....the dancers, actors, the music and choreography will entertain you. The sets were innovative the quick prop changes will surprise you. A very entertaining and moving experience.

title: Must go live show
review: it was such as amazing experience, it was a true Bollywood experience. you do not regret watching the show. it is filled with dancing and singing which makes it super fun and it gives you a great deal of information about Taj mahal, which makes it all worthwhile.

title: excellent
review: Excellent show , must watch , though the tickets are costly , can be pre booked , u can get in touch with a agent to get the seats booked , in my case it was Hemantji (9837285822) ,he is a very helpful guy, must watch if you are in agra

title: Amazing
review: One should visit Kalakriti to witness the bizarre cultural heritage of Agra ...The Handicrafts were amazing

title: Visit of Kalakriti was amazing...
review: When we visited workshop at Kalakriti it was amazing experience and we felt ourselves on another world. So excellent workers and artists who were working on the stone and giving shape them into Taj Mahal, centre table, dining table etc. Really wonderful. Moreover watching the show 'Mohabbat The Taj' was our lifetime achievement. Artists who were playing their respective parts performed with full of excellency and seeing their performance we can say they all are matchless. Apart from their acting stage arrangement with lighting system is marvellous & at last rising of Taj Mahal on the stage is amazing…..

title: Bollywood theme show of the Taj
review: It is a nice and colorful show of the Taj Mahal with a strong bollywood influences.

title: The Love Story of the Taj Mahal Show
review: The well-performed and entertaining cultural show of the story of the Taj Mahal was worth the price to enjoy the costumes, music and scenery at the Kalakriti Center.  Although no photography is allowed, the images will stay in your memory.  Headsets are provided to understand the dialog in several languages.  You will have a good experience.

title: Great Time
review: Visit to Agra is incomplete if you don't watch this Show. It was one of the best experience of my life time. Especially with your partner next to you.

title: Go! Go!
review: This show is very well done, a great cultural event for Westerners. It will give you some Bollywood, some insight into the Story of the Taj Mahal. Recommend seeing the show after your visit to the Taj and Agra Fort. Headphones worked just fine.

title: Historic insight into the Taj Mahal
review: This show give you an overview of the history surrounding the Taj Mahal.

title: The best place to buy Marble inlay work .
review: This place is amazing for shopping & viewing the evening show of the story of Taj told in a bollywood style.

title: An inclusive Holi
review: We joined a group at the Convention Centre for Holi. Dressed in the white top and trousers provided by our tour organiser, we danced, painted each other with chalk colours and enjoyed the friendly atmosphere. We watched the main dance event and were treated to Indian canapés and a sweet eat made for the feativL.

title: Great show!
review: I came with low expectations given there weren't much recomendaciones about it.

title: A good show
review: We have attended a show about the story of Taj Mahal. Dances and costumes are so joyful and full of energy. I do recommend it if you cannot attend a local one

title: Kalakriti Center
review: Attended the musical about the love affair between the emperor and queen that led to the construction of the Taj Mahal.  Impressive production

title: MTGC CROSSBORDER INCREDIBLE INDIA
review: “Mohabbat The Taj” is a fascinating play that depicts the saga of love and a memorable journey into history. The Drama tells us the story of true and eternal love of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for his beloved wife Mumtaj Mahal. It will also showcase the plushy lifestyle of mughal period, through song and drama supported by cutting-edge devices and audio-visual technology.

title: Beautiful marble crafting, delivered as promised!
review: After enjoying a brief and very interesting tour of the marble works at Kalakriti and the all but extinct art of marble crafting with stone inlay, I became determined to purchase an inlaid marble table.  How could I resist Taj Mahal craftsmanship after seeing the Taj!!  Prices were discussed and negotiated. I selected a beautiful marble table with a cherry table base.  We reviewed terms and timetable for arrival of the piece and I paid with credit card.  I received my table yesterday by freight/FedEx delivery, well packaged and in perfect condition - every bit as nice as I remembered and several weeks earlier than the 8-12 week delivery time frime expected.   I am very pleased to vouch for the integrity and quality of the Kalakriti company and product.  This is a great place to visit in Agra, whether you are interested in buying a marble piece of not!

title: Sells marble - worth the investment
review: well worth a visit for the marble demonstrations and products.  We bought marble from here and it has arrived safely in the UK intact and in pristine condition.  Enjoy the visit, and trust the sincerity of the team, they are geniune

title: Excellent display. Seems overpriced though
review: They have a great and varied collection especially of the marble inlay work. The pricing seems high, catering to foreign tourists. Worth a visit to get an idea of this art6

title: Bollywood meets Tj Mahal
review: A fantastic Bollywood movie type show, beautiful coloured costumed dancers help tell the incredible and sad story that led to Shah Jehan constructing one of the wonders of the world.

title: The marble work is exquisite
review: It was my first experience of watching artisans work on the famous In-lay Marble work of Agra. The same work used in the Taj Mahal.

title: If you like bollywood you'll love this show
review: We came with Explore India Group for a performance of Mohhanat the Taj Show.  A live musical with headphones provided to listen in one of  8 different languages.  The costumes were great.  The dancing was like in a bollywood film. Presents the history of the construction Taj Mahal.

title: Must see Show
review: The show tells you about the Taj story in Pantomime form.  It is a MUST SEE in my opinion.  You can pay a bit extra to get dressed up as Maharanis and Maharajas and get to sit in the front row.

title: It was Ok
review: i didnt like the show......actually the tickrt price was really high ....as well as the stuff was really expensive

title: Real show
review: Really very intrastate live show . amazing how the persons who play roll ,change the dresses very fast, how they change back ground ,set etc. what a lighting, decoration ,laser lights ,sounds amazing . i recommended to see this show how have time in Agra .

title: Nice show
review: Must watch the live show of kalakriti. Take a ballon ride from here.pl.ensure the show timing before leaving agra. Never miss this show.

title: Beautifully told story
review: A last minute entry proved to be worth it. Tickets can be expensive. The story of the Taj is beautifully narrated. The end is good. The way the stage is set in a very short time is marvelous and amazes you. Check the show times. Its worth it.

title: Must visit place
review: It is great work by so many people. It is mix of many art together. Show you marble art with Bollywood dance.

title: Good Experience
review: Pure Urdu. Good show. Good ambience and location. When you are in Agra, it is definitely one time show. Professionalism in artists and services need to be improved.

title: Life time memorable Show ..... Waj Taj :)
review: Really life time memorable show...

title: The story of love/Taj..... Could be told better
review: Visited the Kalakriti centre and watched the shows in a full house show where foreigners easily outnumbered localities which proves of its popularity amongst visiting tourists.

title: A show not to be missed.
review: Visit Taj as many times as you want but do go to the show at least once here. Worth it. And words cannot describe it.

title: Fantastic show
review: This show is amazing!! It tells the story of the life and love between Shah Jahan and his wife Mumtaz and how the Taj Mahal came into being.

title: Not to be missed
review: We went to see The Saga of Love not knowing what to expect. What an evening. The show was wonderful, it is in Hindi but you headsets to hear it on your language. The costumes are full of colour.  It was you are at a Bollywood movie but better.

title: Best stage show...
review: One of the best stage show i have ever seen. The show is all about Shahjahan and The Taj. Nicely prepared stage...light and sound effects....and avaiable in 14 languages....i would rather say that if u are in Agradont miss this mesmerazing show.

title: Do not miss out
review: Our guide in Delhi suggested we do this in Agra and boy are we happy we did. It is a nice show or dancing, music, and colour. The story line might be a bit boring at times but a nice show none the less. Seats range between 1000 and 1800 rupees from top to front row, so not expensive. We took our kids (2&4) and they were mesmerized by the show.

title: best  place to handicrafts.
review: This is one of the beautiful place to see the handicrafts .

title: A good historical journey..!!!
review: Before visiting Taj Mahal, one should get a detailed history about Taj & for getting so a must visit place is Kalakriti. The artist who perform here are excellent & the way of their storytelling is very totally different from other shows we have seen about TAJ.

title: Bollywood all the way
review: I'm not usually a Bollywood fan but this is a must see if in Agra- the cheap seats are in the upper level but you get a much better view up there. Nice wee cafe inside and complimentary water provided - nice.

title: Mohabbat the Taj show isn't Bollywood
review: This was promoted by our tour company as a Bollywood show, which it isn't really.  The stage show combines live performance, film backgrounds, and recorded music to tell the story of how the Taj Mahal came to be, and the love story between Shah Jahan and Mumtaz Mahal.

title: AGRA -history ,love ,art & culture ...all at one place
review: KALAKRITI is basically a cultural & convention center in Agra & this place is bringing together Love ,art ,culture ,tradition & history of AGRA at one place .

title: Marvellous
review: Great. Dont miss it for anything.

title: nice place for light and sound show
review: Kalakriti is private place. in this compound nice shopping complex. very clean and all person  is very kind.

title: Good one !!
review: It's a nice musical drama cum dance show. It's saga of King Shah Jahan and Mumtaz. Kalakriti Cultural & Convention Center is located near Radisson Blu hotel. Everyday show starts at 6.30 pm. Ticket counter is located in front of auditorium. Food and photography is not allowed inside auditorium. Foreign language assistance is available. Ticket price is little bit costly.

title: Melodramatic experience of the saga of Shah Jahan
review: This is the second time I visited the Mohabaat-e-Taj. This time I got a little bit of unpleasant experience, though overally both me and my wife both have a memorable time. There are 3 tickets available at 1800/-, 1500/- and 1200/-. We took the 1500/- stuff and I can concise my experience in these few points.

title: Good theater at Taj Mahal
review: Watch the love story of the Taj Mahal.

title: Well Maintained
review: The place is clean and properly maintained. The dance drama show was the added attraction and is one of the finest show.

title: Night Cultural Performance
review: We went to the play about the story behind the building of the Taj Mahal. There were earphones so we could hear a translation in English, but at times the volume of what was happening on stage made it difficult to hear the translation. Three of us enjoyed it, but the male in our group fell asleep!

title: Nice way to spend a couple of hours in the evening
review: We visited the place after visiting Taj and the show really complemented our visit to the taj.. A really pleasant way to spend an evening in Agra when one is done with all the sightseeing.. The tickets are slightly on the expensive side but the kind of effort that is put in with so many actors and all the props etc I felt it was justified.. It is not a very big theatre so one can easily buy the Silver Tickets which are the cheapest and sit and enjoy the show .. The highest paid ones are platinum for Rs 1800.. The tickets can be easily purchased on the spot from the booking counter.. The show is in Hindi and they provide translation in about 10 languages over the head phones:. The only problem is that the headphones do not cancel the outside noise and one can hear both the sounds.. They can surely work on this aspect and make the experience all the more worthwhile

title: Indian Adventure
review: We took in this early evening show which depicts thé love of thé Mogul for his 3rd wife which ends in her death and then building of thé Taj Mahal in her memory. The story was beautifully portrayed from thé large cast assembled.

title: Taj history in a very decent way
review: he Saga of Love show about Shah Jahan, Muntaz and the Taj Mahal is a delight - like watching a Bollywood movie live on stage! Don't miss it.

title: Best way to end the day in Agra!
review: These show is really beautiful. They tell you the love story behind the Taj Mahal, it has great performances and also beautiful dances. They also provide you headsets and you can choose from 10 different languages so you can understand the show. They also had a beautiful mini replica of the Taj Mahal which also had semi precious stones. would recommend to end your day in Agra watching this beautiful show.

title: Mesmerising......
review: The epic story of Shahjahan and his wife Mumtaj is performed in this live theatre by more than 100 artists. The costume, the set,the lighting creates a lasting impression of the show. I thoroughly enjoyed this 90 minutes live performance. You will for sure fall in love once again. The atmosphere really creates a wonderful impression not only on minds but it also touches our hearts.

title: Watched the cultural show here
review: Show is good especially if you are not aware of the history of the Taj.   Prices for the show are high; especially since no food is included with it.

title: Kalakriti Emporium
review: We visited the Emporium here for see how they made the mosaic tables etc.  Was very interesting and some of the tables etc were just fantastic.  Even though we did tell them that we not/not interested in buying there was a little pressure to do so.  Worth a visit to see how they actually shape the tiles.  Beautiful marble inlay work that adorn the walls of the iconic Taj Mahal, are replicated in some of the pieces.

title: Seen to be believed. 100 times better than Taj Mahal itself
review: If you are a tourist you may miss visiting Taj Mahal but do not miss Kalakriti Cultural Dance Show. The theater is comparable to the world best in Paris or New York. It run two shows  of Mohabbat-The-Taj which is a fascinating play that depicts the saga of love and a memorable journey into history.The Drama portrays the Mughal era in 16th Century,It is series of play depicting the true and immortal love of Shajahan for Mumtaj Mahal- his beautiful wife; the lavish lifestyle of Mughal era; immaculate hardship of the artisans for 22 years that created the most precious specimen of craftsmanship. It is just Seen to be believed. 100 times better than Taj Mahal itself. Do not miss it if you visit Agra.

title: Lovely Show...but bit overhyped
review: I went to see this show on the recommendation of my guide and taxi driver. If you really enjoy dances and want to see worlds largest marble replica of Taj... then you must visit and watch the show.

title: Artistic depiction of Taj story
review: The performance by the artists was average, perhaps over-rated. The diction in English was even worse. The best part was the replica of Taj, which came on the conclusion of the show.

title: Mohabbat E Taj show
review: Came here to see the Mohabbat-e-Taj live show, which depicts the love story in typical Bollywood song, dance and theatre form. I am told that the show is being performed everyday for the last 9 years.

title: Excellent shopping and entertainment!!
review: It's an amazing place to shop for world class artefacts.. Very tastefully made.. The cultural shows in the evening are not to be missed!!

title: Overpriced but enjoyable!
review: We were quiet tentative whether to do this show or not....we found mixed reviews and the price seemed too much...we went nonetheless...the tickets were for Rs. 1200, 1500 or 1800 depending on the seats..we took the 1500 ones...good seats...the show was almost full...it was fairly nice and enjoyable....its the dramatization of the love story behind TajMahal with a lots of mugal era type dances.....good but still feel the price should not have been more than Rs 750 ...

title: Entertaining!
review: We went there at night and it was the first show we saw in india.  Everything was gorgeous and my daughter kept saying how the girls looked very pretty ;)  Thumbs up fo this fantastic show!!!

title: TAJ, Red Fort and Kalakriti. 3 must visit places of Agra.
review: Their is not much awareness about this place among Indian tourists. Most taxi and tours operators dont even mention this, but I found this place as by far the best collection of art anywhere in modern India. The stone handicrafts created by the artisans of this place are mind-boggling. Just too good just to look at the creations, as the prices are understandably beyond an average Indian tourist. The cultural show was also world class and worth the price.

title: A nice evening activity if you are in Agra
review: On our recent visit to Agra, we wanted to see Bollywood style dancing and singing. The show at the Kalakriti Cultural & Convention Center fit the bill, and provided an easy-to-follow historical highlight of the Taj. Each seat is equipped with headphones from which you can select your local language, and this worked out better than expected as the synchronisation between the headphones and the stage performance is very good.

title: Great show!
review: Highly recommend Kalakriti live show depicting the story behind the magnificent Taj Mahal. 3 tier price system 1200, 1500 & 1800 rupees but in all honesty the auditorium is small so even the seats in the third tier will all have a good view.

title: Good collection, but pricey !
review: At Kalakriti, you will find a good storehouse of Moghul artefacts, right from silk sarees to jewel carpets. Very good collection, but pricey !

title: Worst show ever seen
review: The only entertainment our group of 16 got was laughing because it was so horrible. It is half live and half video. Everyone has to wear headphones so it can be done in different languages. The trouble is you can still hear the local dialogue over the headphones. Absolute worst acting ever. Could not tell if they were laughing or crying. Definitely save your time and money on this one.

title: See the Taj and its legends come alive
review: The show at Kalakriti re-creates the story of Agra, the Braj Bhoomi and the seat of Mughals. In a broadway show tradition, it recreates the era with all its opulence using the modern techniques. Must see for overseas visitors to get a feel of the Agra when it was its glorious best.

title: Remarkable Show
review: Live theater show at Kalakriti was splendid. I enjoyed the Indian folk music, their costumes, dance, presentation.... All were superb. I was dazzled to see people performing live and the host were very funny and did a great job. I thoroughly enjoyed the show.

title: Theatre and store
review: My favorite place to shop in Agra, at the same tame it gives beautiful show about the love story of Mum taj Majal and Sha Jahan, recently open a cafeteria inside  with the best pancakes ever.

title: Excellent !!!
review: An excellent play to showcase the history behind Taj Mahal. Kudos to all the artists for the marvellous play.

title: love show
review: it is a  nice idea to spend ur nigh in agra watching the show. the Mohabbat show is nice and at the end u will be able to have a photo with the actress and a mini taj mahal for a fee.

title: great to shop and get shipped home
review: Carpet making, marble inlaying. Watched carpets being made by hand, really interesting .Fantastic marble items to buy. Watched items being made. Quality and at a reasonable cost. Brought a marble table top and had it shipped home. So cheap and arrived in a week on returning home. Great keep sakes from my India trip.

title: Good show
review: Went to see the show about how the Taj was built, very colorful and pretty but I swear, it was so cheesy I was laughing the whole time. They really overacted the whole thing so much, still, nice time, very nice venue, if you dont have anything better to do, go see it.

title: Good but very expensive
review: Good experience to see live stage show to know about Shahanjahn & Mumtaz. But ticket price is too high i.e. INR 1000/- PP, even for children age upto 5 years. We had to spend Rs. 4000/- for family of four (two adults & two children) . There should be discounted family package.

title: Kathak fusion
review: A must see at least once. The splendor of the place is breathtaking. The choreography, costumes and the use of technology is simply awesome.

title: Awesome and colorful musical show venue.
review: I love the shows and have never had any complains about the headsets given for translation of the show in different language. Each time i go there i can not help but get goose bumps during the "mohobbatain-e-taj" show.The tickets are reasonable for the setup and show as per my view. Most recommended . It has a fix timing so please book in advance the show date and time and also has limited seats.

title: great show
review: Saw the show here the night before visiting the Taj.  The story of the Rajas great love for his wife is told in song and dance by  beautifully costumed performers. I wondered if it might be a bit cheesy but not so. The show is commentated and I think that hearing the story greatly added to the experience when we visitedvthe Taj Mahal.

title: Must visit place at Agra
review: Its a worthwhile place to visit and surely gone enjoy the kind of plays and other activities happened at Kalakriti is amazing.

title: Recommend for once
review: Mix of Bollywood and Mughal history with the equipments of 21st sanctuary . Deserve at least one visit while you are at City of Taj Mahal , will give lots of idea about Mughal era and their glory . Traditional Colourful costumes , Jewllery and many things to bring glimpse of Mughal era . Worth to see if you don't have to skip any other monument since this city has lots of history apart of Taj Mahal . Clean place with nice performance of lots of young artist , wish they would have allowed camera without flashlight . Great team work , recommend to art lover .

title: Don't waste your time and money
review: We went to this expecting a camp but fun Bollywood show about the Taj Mahals origins. Instead we got little to no story, wooden dialogue and over the top acting. To be fair, the actors didn't have much to work with.

title: A learning experience
review: After visiting the Taj Mahal, one can visit this place and learn how the inlaid marble was produced. Mr. Maqbool will explain the process and one can see how labor intensive the inlaying process of marble is. There are items for sale and it will be shipped to you and well packaged against damage.

title: Kalakriti Performance
review: We happened upon the performance of Kalakriti. Don't expect a great broadway show here. It's Bollywood meets high school or less. The music and acting is all pre-recorded. The dancing is real and that definitely has a bollywood-feel and was entertaining. The storyline is okay but don't expect to come away from it with any great historical knowledge. Still, it was enjoyable on some level.

title: Promised much, delivered less
review: Went for the English show and were a disappointed when comparing the promises made in advance with what was delivered, for quite a bit of money. Colourful remake of the story of the Tah Mahal with opulent dresses, but dancers were mostly on the mediocer side. As were the translations provided on the headphones. Whilst Englis was seemingly ok and one could follow well, german and french were very poor. Not a 'must' whilst in Agra, from my perspective!

title: Kind of bland
review: We went here to see the play about Shah Jahan and Taj Mahal.  Being theater fans and volunteering at theaters we were excited to see this professional production on a subject we had recently learned about.

title: Really terrible show
review: We went to Kalakriti given that it is the only big show in Agra but with pretty low expectations. Even those low expectations could not be met. The show seemed to be designed for tourists who have no aesthetic sense at all and are willing to put up for 80 minutes worth of crap that passes for song and dance and play for an exorbitant price.

title: Unprofessional but no better options around !
review: Our show started at 6:45 pm .

title: What a great show!
review: Very well written dialogue and great music. Everything from the auditorium to the actors were amazing. They also had audio narration in 13 different languages to make sure everyone could enjoy.

title: Campy Show about a Great Love
review: This is a "musical" about the love between Shah Jahan and Mumtaz Mahal, that resulted in the Shah having the greatest mausoleum ever built for his wife when she died.  The show is in Hindi, but there are ear phones in many languages, so you won't miss out.  It's a bit corny - in true Bollywood style - but still an experience.

title: Romantic Show
review: Excellent show to get the information about Taj Mahal. It is based on the sad and sweet story of love, & affection. However it is very expensive to watch it. But worth the price. Everyone must visit and watch it once.

title: Good fun
review: A very stylised and romantic take on the well known Shah Jehan/ Mumtaz Mahal story.  Not true to the history but a good Bollywood take on it with the required song and dance sequences and ham acting.  Good fun, don't take it as the definitive story.

title: Poor acted, Bollywood style musical
review: Very expensive, for Indian standards, musical based on the story of Shah Jahan and his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Shah Jahan built the Taji Mahal mausoleum for his wife when she died. The musical is in the style of Bollywood; if you like that then the show may be OK. Otherwise is like a school play. I would have rather spent the evening in a decent restaurant.

title: Don't miss this programme if you are in Agra
review: The story of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz is enacted right in front of your eyes. If you have seen the Taj but not this programme you need to visit Agra again to see it. Keep an evening free to see this programme - visit to Taj should have a night halt in Agra.

title: best to see in evening
review: after the tour of Agra this live show really a fantesty drama on stage.with dance,drama and music.but cameras and cell phones are not allow to carry inside the auditorium.

title: Most entertaining
review: A sweet musical rendition of the the Shah Jahan & Mumtaz Mahal love story.  The costumes are lovely, the dancers clearly loved what they were re-enacting.  They provide head-sets with the different international languages so one can listen to the audio in your own language as well as a compimentary bottle of water.  No cameras/video recordings allowed.

title: Fabulous
review: We had front row seats to the show which was about the building of the Taj Mahal.  We had ear phones with an English translation.  The show told the story of the building of the Taj Mahal, there were beautiful costumes, song and dance.  It is well worth doing prior to your visit to the Taj as it helps you understand.  At the end of the 1 and a half hour show we had our picture taken with the cast.  A great moment.

title: Excellent cultural peek, not to be missed.
review: The show starts at 6:45PM and most days you can get the tickets easily. The auditorium seats more than 500 people and has the show translated into multiple languages (they give you a pair of headphones with the translated script of the play). Story about how and why Shah Jahan made the massive mausoleum and supported well by good acts and dances. Towards the tail end of the show the Miniature Taj mahal made of real marble and gemstones emerges from the stage and makes for a grand closure. There's also a showroom of exquisite handicrafts that serve for a good momento.

title: A journey into history
review: One should see this programme before actually visiting Taj. This programme is a musical drama about the history of Taj. Only one show every day. Hence prior booking must on vacation times. You can choose to listen in a language of your choice.Great show.

title: Good place for evening entertainment
review: The event is organized very professionally. The fees are a bit on the higher side but worth it. The actors, the choreography, the dresses and costumes are all very well done. For new comers, it will give some of the background into the Taj and the events leading up to building it. All in all I would recommend it especially if you are travelling with your family...they will love it

title: lovely stage costumes
review: depicting the background of taj and shah jahan and mumtaz and all... I really love the dances and costumes and all... but half way through the show, I was so sleepy and and I can't wait for the next change of backdrop or dance or costume to pop up.

title: A Great Experience!!!
review: This 80 minutes play is great to watch. It's got everything - Romance, Dance, Drama, Music & of course the TAJ. Yes the Taj claimed to be made of the same white marble 'Makrana'.

title: Wouldnt recommend it
review: Would not really recommend it ! Honestly.Have seen much better cultural shows then this . In Agra, nothing beats the Taj Mahal

title: You can't miss this while in Agra
review: The whole show On Taj-the love  is so artistically created that you just enjoy it ... not to speak of the more than a museum and unlimited varieties of handicrafts , marble and clothes ..

title: agra place to visit
review: Hi, They started over again. It is nice to see, but personally I am not that found of folk dances and things. if you have spare time plan for this. I would say its one time watch.

title: Not to be missed
review: Went to this show after visiting The Taj Mahal which made a great end to the day

title: Brings kitsch to a new level.
review: If you got a good sense of humour I strongly recommend you go.

title: Go, walk around and comeback
review: Exceptionally Over-priced, over rated and not worth spending large sum for a under-performed Drama. Primarily focused to earn money then providing quality service.

title: End your day here
review: I reluctantly went to watch this show after a day tour of the taj and the fort, but I am happy that I did. Some much of colour, so many dances and lots of energy. I am sure if you do it you will not regret doing it. Best way to end your day in Agra.

title: Boring show!!!
review: We were little confused whether to go for this show or not as we got mixed reviews. We still though to give it a try. The show is quite expensive, but considering the cost involved the show is not upto the level and not recommended. Its waste of money and time.

title: Mohabat de Taj
review: Uhh, well, he really loved her. Like a lot. A whole lot. And she was real smart. And pretty. No, but seriously. The music and costumes and set were great. The acting a bit over the top but hey, it's an over the top story. A neat thing to do while in Agra and the theater is very cool looking.

title: Good show
review: It was nice show, however my expectations were more, probably I was comparing it with Kingdom of Dreams experience.

title: Good....
review: This is the convention center organizing local cultural dance and music programs daily.... plays are also bein organized here.... nice place to relax in the evening...

title: Nice show
review: Seated front row we enjoyed the stories of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz, the lovely costumes and the beautiful decor.

title: Waste of money
review: my group was charged $35 for the show in which the acting was so bad it was funny.   The only saving grace was the Taj Mahal replica at the end, but we had to sit through an hour of tortuous music to see it.  Save your money, or better yet visit Mother Theresa's orphanage and give the money to them.

title: Mohabbat The Taj - Best Show
review: I got the opportunity to see the show. It was like heaven. Stage was so beautiful and all the performances were adorable. Good thing is that although the show is in Hindi, they have audio translators to 12 foreign languages. I would term it resurrection of Theater art in India. Must see,

title: A very odd experience
review: This performance is presented for tourists and consists of some lively Bollywood singing and dancing interspersed with a somewhat over-the-top theatrical performance about the origins of the Taj Mahal.  This was a blatant tourist trap.

title: one of the best show in India
review: If you want to know about historical facts reagrding Taj Mahal in the back ground of Music in the comfort of a world calss auditorium ,you must visit this place

title: Amateurish
review: My first Bollywood show was a little disappointing I expected more. The costumes were wonderful but the actual dancing was not what I expected. They do have audio so you can listen to the translation however I opted to listen to it without the earphones as we had already heard the story of the Taj Mahal. If the show was $10.00 it wouldn't have been a problem.

title: Do not recommend!
review: I do not understand why this show got 4 stars. This was a complete waste of my $30- the show was very amateurish and half my group and I ran away halfway.

title: Truly Marvelous
review: If you are in Agra and have some time, you must must watch this show. Well managed and very beautifully scripted.

title: Its a very good place for shopping
review: Its a very good place for shopping A bit pricey but you get the high quality stuff here. Also to experience local culture at its best

title: Mohabbat a Taj.. Flop show
review: We were 5 adults and one child who were really excited about the show but it turned out to be a disaster .. The music was boring .. Acting was overacting and the dancers were not in sync ... The biggest drawback was that for the changeover in scene they used to give long blackouts .. In today's world of technology this is not expected especially when u are paying Indian rupees 1200 for a single ticket..

title: Pretty good Indian musical
review: I just got back from the show with my wife and 2 and half daughter and it was a good experience. The theatre is quite comfortable, the headphones are working well with 10 available languages. The show is as colorful and glowy as any Indian musical with good songs and dances. Now if you don't like Indian musical you may better stay in hotel. Our family enjoyed it

title: Good show
review: A must see when visiting Agra . It's nice to see that such shows are being done now in India .

title: simply awsome
review: i felt proud that india also had international standard superb live show depicting story of taj in 10 different foreign languages. musical theater was excellent with very colourful nice costumes, very good music and dances which could take you back in the era of kings. must visit.

title: Can be much much better if some minute changes are made !!!
review: On my recent visit to agra we visited this centre.. some info about the same..

title: A must visit
review: We visited kalakriti to watch their play on shahjahan and mumtaz's love story and I must say that kalakriti became the highlight of our trip apart from the taj mahal ofcourse. We booked gold class tickets which are front row and give  u a chance to dress up as shahjahan or mumtaz and watch the play, a delight for kids and adults alike. The dress and make up artists are pro and believe me that they will transform u into royalty within minutes . The play is beautifully directed and quite spectacular to say the least. Headphones are available with English and other foreign language options for those not familiar with hindi/urdu. Go there for a trip back to the mughal era and u won't be disappointed

title: Great show
review: It was a great show. There was too much dance. To make it interesting they could add how Mumtaj married Janagir and more historical contents, Reduce dance part of it.

title: Excellent collection and service
review: Every time I go for shopping in Agra, I feel that I am getting ripped off.  Now, I have found a place where I feel comfortable taking my clients and friends.  Superb collection and service levels.  Prices are negotiable...so request for a bargain.  Ask for Mr.Vivek .  He know the history of Agra, the artisans behind the masterpieces and very knowledgeable.  The experience of visiting the place has only been positive.  Good job team kalakriti.

title: Dance Drama
review: A professionally well choreographed dance drama, artistically performed, excellent back stage management with a superb emporium next door.

title: Overcharged
review: I attended this show with a tour group of 15. We were charged 2,500 rupees which was collected by our guide. He must have skimmed off the top. Interesting to have the variety of translations by headphone but the Hindi from the stage was far too loud to understand anything over the headphones. I thought the show itself was innovative but over the top.

title: superb craftsmanship
review: You should visit this center and see the wonderful craftsmanship inlaying small colored semi precious stones onto marble table tops  etc. Whilst not cheap the products make an excellent present and memoir of Agra.

title: Not impressed
review: My review is probably biased because I compared this show with the Kingdom of Dreams show I saw two days before in Delhi and it comes up lacking. My party of four and I kept falling asleep and waiting for it to just end.  My earpiece did not work very well at first, but the attendant came over and helped. We were talked into seeing this show by our guide and I believe he probably suggested it because he was getting a kickback. I don't believe it's worth the price and would not return.

title: Do not forget to bargain, I didn`t, but I do not bother either
review: A very nice environment, where you find high quality products whether it`s marble, carpets, pashmina or cashmere, stones etc. I was there much longer than originally expected - most probably, y`ll experience the same . . .

title: "Excellent Marble Art"
review: I was mesmerized with the amazing craftmanship. We spent an entire day at Kalakriti and I loved the story of The Taj Mahal. Every piece is so beautiful and there is something to please everyone. .  I was really impressed by how close you can get to some of these works. Everyone should visit here!

title: Amazing
review: When I heard this place and regarding performance ,I thought it would be like other light and sound show.But when I entered the convention center my total view was changed.Me and my other friends enjoyed the show with deep concentration .

title: Not that special...
review: We did not like this show... It is not that special and it is far too much touristic... Most of the group got bored... I'm sorry, but I do not recommend it.

title: A great experience
review: This was a live performance - colorful, vibrant, great music and great clothes.  They give you headphones with translation in English and that wasn't very good.  But overall it was charming and mesmerizing.

title: Ripoff!
review: Maybe because of off season we were really put off by this place. The entire place seemed to be in darkness because there were no visitors on the handicrafts side. They only put on the fans and lights when we asked them to. On the marble side there was too much marble dust and it was hard to breathe. We beat a hasty retreat. The stuff is also hugely overpriced. Note that there's no evening show until 15 jul because of off season. Go here if u must but I'm sure Government emporia even in Delhi are far better and cheaper than this.

title: Really enjoyed the show, romanticized the Taj story!
review: I enjoyed the show and felt it gave a very interesting, theatrical persepective of the Taj Mahal!  The acting was a bit over the top but enjoyable.  The scale model was amazing!  I would recommend attending before visiting the Taj.

title: Flashy and expensive
review: I could not quite understand why so many buses were standing outside this place in the evening when we went for shopping there. On making inquiries I came to know that almost all big hotels send their guests to this place for shopping and watching the musical The Taj. I myself did not see the musical as the ticket was too expensive for my pocket and moreover it looked more like a bollywood kind of play from the costumes etc in the adverts all over Agra.

title: One time watch... esp. for the last Taj model
review: As an Indian, the songs, dances and drama would not be something you would never seen before. Kingdom of Dreams at Gurgaon would give more of that at the same price. But what I liked was the sequence where a Taj marble model comes up and is shown in different settings. Overall, go there once for the sake of your family but once's enough. For foreigners, this is definitely a must visit as they might like to take a glimpse of Indian culture. Wish they were priced a li'l lower though.

title: Great Cultural Show
review: I watched the show after a full day of exploring Agra. The show is really great, packed with dance and musical performance. It's like seeing a live bollywood movie :)

title: Very good cultural show and Taj display
review: Show starts at 6:30 and is 40min duration. Tickets prices at Rs 1000, 1200 , 1400. You can call them and reserve the tickets or purchased in advance.  Show is musical explaining mughal history, ending off with a colorful display of huge taj mahal replica

title: Not too bad
review: Watched the Taj Mahal. Best to purchase gold or platinum ticket. The story was just decent, but the dancing and the music are the one that blow your breath away. Ending was just so so. But still worth to visit.

title: Awesome show " mohabbat e taj "
review: Must visit cultural show for memorable trip...It was awesome , the dresses , the actors , the play , the music evrything was fantabulous...Little much like kingdom of dreams gurgaon..But found it a little overpriced..

title: MUST SEE SHOW
review: Our guide suggested we should see this show. We weren't sure. We were only in Agra for 2 nights to do the obligatory Taj Mahal visit so did not have much time. However, we did not expect to go back to Agra so felt we should not risk missing the opportunity - we wouldn't get it again. So, we decided to go - and it blew our minds. Yes it is "just" a stage version of a Bollywood film. The plot was weak, the script weaker, the acting OK but very stylized.

title: Bollywood comes to. Agra
review: Bollywood style display of the history of the Taj Mahal. Great recommendation of the tour escort Rajeev Butalia.

title: Great show
review: it tell story of legendery love of shah jahan and mumtaz mahal and story behind Taj Mahal.

title: Repetitive performance
review: We were looking forward to the show - wasn't cheap - many of those in our group enjoyed it, but having seen such shows in say Bangkok for instance, I found it quite repetitive and boring.

title: The storey behind the building of thr Taj Mahal
review: Must see show, before you visit the Taj Mahal. The storey behind the building of the Taj Mahal set to music. 30 "bollywood" style dancers on the stage at a time, good effects.

title: Taj Mahal
review: Very informative play.Choreography and entire performance was excellent.Very colourful There are headphones with whatever language you speak to tell you the story of why the Taj Mahal was built.  Very professional and a good show,although i found it a little expensive

title: A Drama form to understand the Taj story
review: The cultural show here is recommended for travelers who want to understand the Taj story via Drama....the Play gets a little boring towards the end but never the less if the purpose is to see the story of the Taj, its a good bet

title: KALAKRITI
review: very well directed and enacted story of Taj Mahel presented in act and dances.

title: Treasure Trove - I am not kidding!
review: I had no idea what this place was about and not many people seemed to know about it. It is not far off from Taj and we got there after a bit of search. It is not very well sign posted. Once in, I was stunned by the amount of handicrafts and the variety they had. Basically, marble tops with stone inlays, sculptures in marble and wood, metal statues, carpets, clothing and jewellery. All in the vicinity of $1000 - $20000. If you can afford, you can lighten up your living room and cause a lot of envy among your friends and family.

title: Colourful indian extravaganza.
review: Exciting,colourful, cavalcade of music and dance. An interaction of film and live drama. Modern technology to bridge the gap of language barrier... only drawback was the headsets picked up signals from selfish people who didnt turn off their phones during the show. The theatre is very well maintained and decorated, giving the feel of mughal palace.

title: WOOOOOOOOOOOOW
review: I like bollywood movies, and this show was like a live movie displayed infront of me. the dancing and decoration will keep your opened without a blink. it's OK if you notice that the actors were exagrating and I really hate the English audio translation but I wish I could listen to them and understand their language. don't miss it it will add fun in your trip

title: kalakriti
review: It is aUnique show must Watched Show they showcase all about Taj Mahal in a Live Format Good Art work at Stage

title: Good Show
review: The 'Mohabbat The Taj' show takes place at 06:15 pm daily. There are four seat categories available – silver, gold, platinum and maharaja costing Rs. 1,000, 1,200, 1,500 and 4,000 respectively.

title: Great Place, had a good time
review: Nice place, but the air pollution catches up to you. conveniently located. Option of Taj show, balloon ride etc for the kids. Large space for really big parties

title: wonderful  experience
review: place is beautiful with very good light and sound arrangements costly for indians tickets are 1500 to 2000 per head but show is very good and real replica of taj emerging from the floor is an amazing experience and there is a hot air show next door in the same complex u can see the taj from a height at sunrise and sunset there is a museum cum gallery next to auditorium where local handicraft on marble available

title: Very expensive
review: Its ok for a foreign traveller who has travelled so far. However for an Indian it is just ok. Expensive though, but the end part where real replica of Taj Mahal is shown, is really amazing

title: Seen the live evening show on 17.10.2013
review: Although the ticket price is high ( INR 2000,1500 and balcony 1,000 ) the performance  and presentation was brilliant and as most of the audience were foreigner they may not find the Ticket price is high compared to live performances in their country.  Photography not allowed but you can have your picture with the artists paying INR 150 per pictures.

title: A mesmerising programme.
review: This is an auditorium where they have performance by artists on history of Taj Mahal. The theatre is very good with nice sound and light arrangements. The programme audio is available in many foreign languages including English.  Overall a performance worth remembering.

title: Good Entertainment
review: Though expensive, it was a brilliant show with very colourful costumes and narration, music etc. The auditorium is also well maintained and in keeping with the premium atmosphere of the show.

title: display or Art and Architecture
review: Enjoy the culture here. Wide range of Art display. You can move around and shop as per your likings.

title: Great exhibition of Indian culture
review: Was the perfect place to showcase Indian history and glimpses of Indian Dance forms. Very colourful and very well choreographed. A must see for all foreigners which was also obvious from the crowd present. Staff very efficient.

title: Well Done
review: Very colourful and good performances. There are headphones with whatever language you speak to tell you the story of why the Taj Mahal was built. Comfortable chairs. Very professional

title: Hard Sell to see this Show
review: WE were given quite a hard see to see this show, however it was really quite good.  The only thing was that it sort of cut short our seeing of the Taj Mahal in order to leave to get to see it in time as it started rather early.  So beware if you want to see the TM at sunset, don't go to this show!  A nice touch was that the actors let you have your pictures taken with them at the end, I presume they were famous in India?

title: wonderful show
review: I saw this show about two month ago with some friends . and i was very much impressed with that i think it is a really new discovery for the tourist whose so ever coming to india . through this show they can see our indian folk dance and culture show , beside it they act like a shahajahan and mumtaj and thier royal court with minister and others . its really fantastic idea i like this show very much and moreover tourist get a chance to see something new and unique . so the tourist are coming to india they should visit this live show .

title: Saga of Tajmahal
review: Very informative play. All actors were well talented and performed very well. The actors were rightly chosen for the roles. Choreography and entire performance was excellent.

title: Dont miss this !!
review: Kalakriti show is the best show  that I never ever seen. The play Taj a love story was magnificent. It depicts the story behind the Taj Mahal.. Its beautifully presented and a great entertainment. This center attracts a large number of tourists along with the local residents. Don’t Miss it.

title: Nice Show
review: It is one of the good shows which is based on Mughal era.They have very good artist to perform the shows. Place is little expansive but it is value for money.

title: Pricy but whole some and satisfying.
review: The two hour long drama presentation at this center is worth a visit. The presentation is immaculate and gives some back ground about building of the Taj.

title: Kalakriti
review: It was good to see kalakriti cultural and convention centre. Mughal handycrafts can be seen there. I liked the cleanlinees and arrangements there and nothing to dislike.

title: Very Pricy, Expensive
review: This is an OK Show for which they take 1000/-.

title: Very interesting experience
review: As part of a visit to Agra, the Kalakriti Center is definitely worth a visit. They have a marvellous auditorium where they host a special show centered around the history of the Taj Mahal. Superb special effects, choreography and settings all done in the most efficient manner possible.

title: Excelent Show......
review: This was my 1st ever great evening show where I and my family really enjoyed. I have a son who is just 2.5 years and does not let us watch movies in theatre properly but he also enjoyed the show last evening. All live performances......great lighting.....great sound.....fabulous artists.....although the management should think of the pricing.....as its too on the higher end.....but I will go again to watch this show......

title: Really Amazing
review: I visited Agra with my GF, i got the passes from my friend, i went for the show, they have more than 10 Languages options & then the live show starts. It was really really amazing, the speed of changing the seen was very fast. Very nice costumes. The show made me cry when Mumtaz dyes. I recommed the people going to Bangalore must see once.

title: European style
review: The show at night was great, very good actors and beautiful dancers. If you take out the indian dresses it could be an european show. Very well conceived. The english translation (áudio) had some disturbances. Better if it had no breaks.

title: Wondeful show
review: Really worth catching if your staying in Agra.

title: Dont miss this
review: The play Taj a love story was magnificient. Dont miss this!!!! must watch and the convention senter is beautiful.

title: Best Show i ever seen
review: Kalakriti show is the best show i ever seen beautifully they present Taj Mahal , view of Yamuna  & Dancing with play

title: Colorful - good if you have time
review: Good and entertaining performance, nice dance, colorful clothing.They could pay more attention to detail such as threads hang loose from (even the emperor) clothes, dancers movement less than perfectly synchronized. In retrospect (always 20-20)  I may prefer a good teas on the coffeshop facing taj mahal. Does not know the price as this is part of the package.

title: a bit sickly
review: I found this over sentimental & sickly.  It could be so much better.  It was nice to go see something whilst at Agra but compared to other shows, missed the mark for me

title: Canned cruise-like dancing show. Stay away !!
review: I was sold a storytelling about the Taj Mahal history with live actors. Let me tell you what I've got:

title: It is ok to see but not a must
review: The show is not too bad but the Chinese translation was very terrible.  It is very difficult for me to understand.  I believe other languages are the same situation.

title: Taj Mahal show and artefact showroom
review: The Taj Mahal show is more Bollywood than actual artistry - but it will give you a great overview of the story of the construction of Taj Mahal. The model of Taj used at the conclusion of the show is a scale model, built specifically for this performance.  The theatre foyer has some beautiful art pieces but the showroom has nothing special.

title: Excellent
review: Must watch show as efforts are good. Dancers perform with as much as energy they have. Excellent. One visiting Agra for Taj must try watching this show as its worth.

title: Exquisite Stuff: For your Eyes only
review: Kalkakriti on the net was a must-visit, sort of arts & crafts hub, housed under one roof. My perception of the place is that its on eof those touristy places which has all arts & crafts stuff: carpets, marble inlay artifacts, silver jewelry,  puppets, clothe items, etc etc....which are very highly priced, though of a good caliber. The prices are not real, and it may suit foreigners who are in Agra/India on a short leash & have v little time to really explore...they can perhaps go ahead & buy a piece of India....but for others, its a touristy spot. Anytheways, you can look it up & enjoy...no prices for your eyes only.

title: boring
review: i slept through the show. the show is about the love of shah Jahan for his wife. they started off well...but after 10 mins they lost the grip over the audience. the dance performances in between were nice. the show is heavily priced. i regret watching it.

title: Perfect introduction about 'saga of Luv'
review: The show was ultimate level of perfection at Agra. One can have the feeling of what made Shahjahan to built The Taj Mahal. The show amazingly shows the bonding between the emperor n his beautiful wife Mumtaj. Its a must watch if ur planning to visit The Taj. One can also see the actual replica of The Taj, which is made up of same marble n other precious stones, the replica is biggest in the world.

title: great performaces of the taj story
review: we went to see the taj but the story behind it confused us so we saw this and it made sense it was really good a little sexual but funny and helped me to understand the story behind the taj

title: Impressive
review: I did go to see a performance on the Taj Mahal history . It was great entertainment. The best thing is the audio equipment is available at the seats in many languages. No need to despair!!

title: Colourful show with all the character of India - impressive model of the Taj Mahal at the end.
review: We went to the show which depicts the story of Taj Mahal and really enjoyed it.

title: Riot of colors and love
review: I will never regret watching this show this month. Perfect treat for your eyes. It's a brief colorful story of love of Shahjahan for his beloved Mumtaj Mahal. Artists are par excellence. Above all, the model of Taj Mahal is superb. Overall, out of this world experience.

title: dance
review: what a performance, if you visit agra go there it id bit expensive but it woth it, there is a show about taj mahal, i like it and dancers are awesome presentation is good you wont feel boring

title: Wonderful show
review: This is the one of its type truely international standard show well directed and the sets were awesome . It was done in true Bollywood style and was worth the 1 1/2 hours of the show .

title: Interesting evening show for family
review: The main event is the play Mohabatt e Taj.

title: ... if only I had not known better ...
review: we went to the Kalakriti Culture & Convention Center for their show telling the story of the founding and making of the Taj Mahal. We were there out of interest for authentic Indian dance. We had been at a Odissi dance performance in Delhi at an earlier visit to India and hoped to show our companions this beautiful dance performance.

title: See the show
review: We saw a dance and drama performance here telling the tragic story of Shah Jahan and his building of the Taj Mahal. Some incredible dancing and a very interesting stylized dramatical performance.

title: Takes you to the Mughal Era
review: It is worth a watch. The actors speak in Urdu so it s better to plug in the interpreter machine earplug to easily understand the dialogues. Great dances, colourful show but if you have been to Kingdom of Dreams, Gurgaon, then you might be bit dismayed because the Zangoora show has a lot more to offer.

title: Great Cultural Show
review: Its a beautiful show and the best part is you can choose the language ......... It depicts the story behind the Taj Mahal and the model of Taj Mahal at the end of the show is great...... In the end you can also click pictures with the artists and get it enlarged ........ Overall a great experience for a tourist .........

title: Be Prepared
review: We loved this show, but it is seriously melodramatic in the best Indian traditions.  I think it is worthwhile to get an insight into how Indians describe events in their history, and how they stage a show, as much as the show itself.  Be aware!  Our show started 7 minutes early!

title: Colourful and entertaining
review: Just relax yourself withnthe dance and story of Taj Mahal, pity not allowed for photograph, so make me sleepy along 1,5hours there..

title: Good dance perfomance
review: Attended Taj Mohabbat show.

title: Not sure it's worth the price
review: My housband and I went to see the show.we found it amusing,but probably not the way it was ment to.we laughed of the lighting and dialouges(the have headset so foreigners can understand the dialogues) and found it entertaining.but its not really worth the price.

title: Way too melodramatic
review: The costumes and dancing were wonderful, but the acting and story were way overacted.  THe auditorium speakers sometimes drowned out the English translation from the earphones.

title: must see if u visit agra
review: a very beautiful live show a saga about taj mahal in different languages very nice auditorium it has a beautiful mini taj very colorful show in evenings.located near tdi mall on fathehabad road near to tajmahal, it has a marble emporium in it also.

title: World class experience
review: We had heard a lot about the programme and what we experienced was musical entertainment of global standard. The theme is superb and performance par excellence. It was once in lifetime experience. we were spell bound and still have fond memory.

title: Love magic
review: This is a good initiative of Mr ashok agarwal in Agra. It is a live show of theatre artist where they dress like king shahjanha and queen mumtaj and play an astonishing role of Mughals. This show brings tears down to the eyes of spectaculars and when they come out of the theater the love between couple and lovers reach to some another level which they never felt.

title: Decent attempt at Stage shows
review: after the high of Zangoora at Kingdom of Dreams, the stage show at Kalakriti Cultural Center - "Mohabbat the Taj" is fairly ok.

title: Must Visit if you have at least one night in agra
review: One of the best live show i have ever seen in my life worth of price.

title: Bollywood in Agra
review: Definitely worth it! For the colours, the dances, the whole atmosphere. The love story of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz leading to the construction of the Taj. There are headsets for a translation of  the dialogues. You can choose among more than 10 languages

title: Live Show
review: We went there to enjoy "Live Play - Mohabbat - E - Taj". The artists were awesome. The tickets are a little expensive but worth it. There were 90 % tourists in the theatre, actually that's the target audience. Headphones were availlable & attached to the seat, so that if you do not understand the language , you have options of getting translation in 9 different languages.

title: Bollywood style show about the Taj Mahal.  Good for kids.
review: We attended the evening show which consisted of scenes that alternated between dance numbers and "dramatic" scenes.  The dance numbers were generally about 20 people on stage dancing in unison in colorful costumes to upbeat Indian music.  The dramatic scenes told the love story of the Taj Mahal - historic fiction with an emphasis on FICTION.  The acting was pretty bad.

title: An overpriced deception
review: We recently visited Agra and our tour guide suggested us to attend this show (as example of bollywood dancing). The show (in hindi with simultaneous pre-recorded translation) is OK regarding Indian clothing and garments, however dancers and actors are dreadful. In addition, our tour guide overpriced our tickets and we paid more than double price. Definitely not advisable.

title: Beware of the price!
review: I went to this show with 5 friends dince our tour guide recommended it. We paid 3000 rupies/ person to sit in the second row (now we know that the price should have been 1200). The show is in bollywood style, with nice colours and fair choreography. However, dancers and actors are far less professional than one would expect paying this price. I do not recommend it for adults; in case you want to go, I suggest to buy cheaper tickets, and ask your tour guide to show them to you.

title: A Great Night Out!
review: My husband and I went here to watch a performance about the love story behind and creation of the Taj Mahal. It was a really nice theatre with comfortable seats, good views, affordable ticket prices and a great live Bollywood experience. The music was great and the play was knowledgable. The only complaint was that the headphones you have to wear for translation were sometimes hard to hear out of as the sound in the theatre itself was quite loud.

title: Live show in most beutiful attire.
review: Kalakriti is an ideal place to spend an evening, if you are staying back in Agra.They organise a Play showing love story behind the making of Tajmahal and is being performed by Local artist. Their presentation, dance sequences and Laser/Light Show is very good.

title: Wonderful performance of the Taj Mahal story
review: Really worth catching if you staying in Agra.  The play Taj Mahal a love story was magnificent.  Mughal handicrafts can be seen there. I liked the cleanliness and arrangements there and nothing to dislike.

title: Show for tourists
review: A show with many videos and dances.

title: Fabulously cheesy but worth the visit for a fun night out
review: India meets Bollywood meets Disney and all in a sort of good way. Audio allows many nationalities to enjoy it all in their own home language. Great costumes, good energy and dancing, bit of overacting and delayed scene changes but all adds to the humour and joy of the night. I think it was supposed to be more serious than I took it to be, our friends took it more seriously and loved it as well, go you wont be disappointed whatever your expectation. PS well priced drinks get served to you in your chairs so a nice touch if you hadn't made it to the bar prior.

title: Beautiful drama
review: Beautiful drama. If you have nothing to do, this is a good place to pass time.

title: nice costumes and nice final scene , the rest so and so
review: a bit long and some times boring. great venue, beautiful costumes and choreography , very touristy though

title: Average show, Poor service
review: We are giving it a two star due to scarcity of activities in agra at night. Otherwise, at most one-star! Well over 80% of audience are from group tours. If it's your first time in India, this show is an acceptable entertainment for an othwise quite evening.

title: Quite enjoyable.Worth the price?
review: Nice that you could have a small bite and a drink while seated and that the text was translated into several languages to be followed through the headphones. The show was lively and colourful.

title: An evening show in Agra
review: This is the only evening show in Agra to my knowledge. It is song, and dance, and a very special show.

title: Animal abuser
review: Attended the show this evening, which was colorful and entertaining.
